10.42.text:
Look, I'm not being funny,
but investing in space travel

15.13.text: is a total waste of money.

16.73.text:
Really? I’d say it’s been a pretty good
investment.

19.70.text:
Come on, it's overly expensive,
just a drain on our resources.

22.95.text:
We’re talking billions being given up,
and what we get for what we’ve bought is

26.12.text:
never certain, we’re just splurging all
this cash into the ether.

29.88.text:
Sorry, I couldn’t hear you there over my
cordless vacuum cleaner.

39.07.text:
Well, come on, tt seems that you’ve forgotten
All the things we get from it.

42.52.text:
Space travel gave us microchips,
memory foam, the internet.

46.37.text:
It gave us cat scans, insulation,
shoe insoles, smoke detectors,

50.45.text:
baby food, Boba Fett,
mobile phones and phone protectors.

54.30.text:
It gave us LEDs, it gave us faster cars, better
engines...

57.74.text:
Look, if you spent that much on anything
you’ll get at least a few inventions.

62.04.text:
All I see is people out there singing David
Bowie anthems.

65.54.text:
Don't you think we'd be better off
if we spent the cash on things that actually

69.20.text:
happen,
you know, to people on this earth?

72.49.text:
Really? It seems like nowhere near enough!
Whens the last time you heard of an catastrophe

77.12.text:
occurring?
An earthquake hits, a tsunami strikes,

79.74.text:
A hurricane emerges,
Or something worse than we’ve encountered,

82.58.text:
whole nations ripped apart.
‘Sorry guys! There’s no supplies,

86.39.text:
you’re going to have to starve,
we just sent our last trillion sending insects

92.17.text:
Fair enough, there’s costs,
But their relatively small,

94.97.text:
and just because a mission sounds odd,
it doesn't mean it's not important.

98.41.text:
I can't work out the use of hardly any of
their experiments.

102.59.text:
Well let's start of with those disasters that
you mentioned:

105.28.text:
Our advancements in meteorology have been
superb.

108.05.text:
Thanks to space travel we can respond
to a disaster before it's even occurred.

112.78.text:
And when we respond we can rely
On GPS and mapping while

116.26.text:
We communicate, share facts online
All of which requires….

128.33.text:
And you really want to stop all that research?
That just seems absurd, I mean

134.00.text:
Think of the lives it has changed,
the lives it has saved,

137.74.text: The return could not be greater!

139.16.text:
Yeah, maybe, if you were born north of the
equator

142.38.text:
You think that just a few inventions go
and make a great investment! No!

145.69.text:
Not when so many people around the world
Aren’t healthy, warm or fed or clothed.

150.28.text:
Space travel’s for the 1%, and those who
make the grade

154.54.text:
as astronauts… well… they kind of look
the same.

157.76.text:
The same background, the same gender
The same skin tone, we’re investing

161.29.text:
In a programme for the future it doesn’t
seem all that progressive

164.44.text:
Yes, we need more diversity,
This world is far from equal

168.48.text:
But I don't think that's a problem with space.
I think that’s a problem with people

178.42.text:
Down here, we try divide ourselves
through status and possessions

181.97.text:
Up there, we’re insignificant,
We’re sawdust, we’re just embers

185.65.text:
we’re tiny, yet united in this blanket that
seems endless

188.67.text:
That doesn’t care about sexuality, class,
skin tone or gender

192.70.text:
Our differences are meaningless
to the universe. It sees through us

196.45.text:
it unites us, it reminds us
that all of us are equal and

199.42.text:
the more that we explore it,
the more we all are faced with it,

202.83.text:
it permeates our culture
our music, entertainment.

205.37.text:
Don’t you think that’s a mindset
that we should be engaging with?

209.06.text:
Let’s say that we didn’t.
We all made the decision

212.43.text: to just give up on these missions.

216.04.text:
Then might as well face
that we’re just living in a prison

223.34.text: We’d be fine! We’d easily get by!

226.31.text:
Yes, but we would be a prison of our own design.
We need something there to reach for,

231.59.text:
that’s what separates us from every other
creature.

234.39.text:
But we can do that here; we just need a sensible
perspective

239.05.text:
I’m sure there’s rocks and plants that
still need testing.

243.72.text:
Ok, fine. But you want to talk about investment?
99.999999% of stuff that we don’t know…

253.23.text:
is up there,
in that direction.
